page.title: 03Lark Hall Goat Farm,Burwell
page.content: There are 26 goats at Lark Hall Farm: 3 stud males, 11 females which milked, 4 goatlings aged 1_2 years who have no kids and 8 female kids. She has British Saanen and Anglo Nubian which have long ears but do not have beards; British Alpine which are black and white and British Toggenburg. The milk is frozen and sold to a man who makes yoghurt and sells it in London. Some dogs have iced goats milk. Goat manure is 40p a bag. Some male goats are sent to the butcher. The lady sells the meat and she gets the skin back for carpet. She gets most milk in midsummer. Then she gets about a gallon a day. The goats eat meadow hay , bran, rolled oats, cooked flaked maize and barley, mineral and vitamin powder.
